author: Not available

text.0: Hwæt, ðu meaht ongitan,      gif his ðe geman lyst,
text.11: windað under wolcnum.      Bið ðeah wuhta gehwylc
text.12: onhnigen to hrusan,      hnipað of dune,
text.13: on weoruld wliteð,      wilnað to eorðan,
text.16: mid his andwlitan      up on gerihte.
text.17: Mid ðy is getacnod      þæt his treowa sceal
text.18: and his modgeþonc      ma up þonne niðer
text.19: habban to heofonum,      þy læs he his hige wende
text.20: niðer swa ðær nyten.      Nis þæt gedafenlic,
text.22: niðerheald wese      and þæt neb upweard!
text.3: habbað blioh and fær,      bu ungelice,
text.5: cuð and uncuð.      Creopað and snicað,
text.7: nabbað hi æt fiðrum fultum,      ne magon hi mid fotum gangan,
text.8: eorðan brucan,      swa him eaden wæs.

source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry
